description:
What is fstab in Lunix? What are fstab options, and when should you use them? Our latest tutorial covers all the fstab details and everything you need to know about this file. Let’s get straight into it.

The post Fstab Options: What Are They, and When Should You Use Them? appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Fstab Options: What Are They, and When Should You Use Them?

description:
In this article, we will provide a few X-based commands that are generally available in most standard distributions today. If you find that any of the X-based commands listed below are not installed on your system, you can always use apt or yum to install the required packages.

The post 11 Useful X-window (GUI Based) Linux Commands appeared first on Linux Today.
title: 11 Useful X-window (GUI Based) Linux Commands

description:
The diff3 command in Linux is a helpful tool that compares three files and shows their differences, which is mainly useful for programmers and system administrators who work with multiple versions of the same file and need to merge them, or identify changes between different versions. In this article, we’ll go through the basics of […]

The post How to Use diff3 Command for File Merging in Linux appeared first on Linux Today.
title: How to Use diff3 Command for File Merging in Linux

description:
In this article, you will learn how to solve the “traceroute: command not found” error on Linux by applying a simple solution.

The post Fixed “traceroute: command not found” in Linux appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Fixed “traceroute: command not found” in Linux

description:
In this article, you’ll learn how to install GCC on Ubuntu, followed by writing and compiling basic C/C++ programs.

The post How to Install GCC on Ubuntu 24.04: A Step-By-Step Guide appeared first on Linux Today.
title: How to Install GCC on Ubuntu 24.04: A Step-By-Step Guide

description:
Are you concerned about your online privacy? Let’s explore some useful strategies to enhance the privacy and security of your Linux PC.

The post A Thorough Approach to Improve the Privacy and Security of Your Linux PC appeared first on Linux Today.
title: A Thorough Approach to Improve the Privacy and Security of Your Linux PC

description:
The AlmaLinux Foundation warns that this new distribution, which was made available today, is not intended for production use but for developers working downstream of AlmaLinux OS.

The post AlmaLinux Kitten Distro: Based on CentOS Stream 10 for Downstream Devs appeared first on Linux Today.
title: AlmaLinux Kitten Distro: Based on CentOS Stream 10 for Downstream Devs

description:
Calamares 3.3.10 released with updates to permissions handling, keyboard, and locale modules.

The post Calamares Installer 3.3.10 Released, Here’s What’s New appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Calamares Installer 3.3.10 Released, Here’s What’s New

description:
Podman shifts to a quarterly release cycle, starting with Podman 5.3 in November 2024, offering predictable updates.

The post Podman Announces Move to Timed Releases appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Podman Announces Move to Timed Releases

description:
The System76 Thelio Astra is an ARM64 machine designed for developers working on autonomous vehicles (AV), automotive safety systems (ADAS), and software-defined vehicle (SDV) development, for native testing and simulation on the same architecture as ARM-based automotive ECUs (Electronic Control Units).

The post System76 Unveils the Thelio Astra ARM64 Ampere-Powered Desktop Computer appeared first on Linux Today.
title: System76 Unveils the Thelio Astra ARM64 Ampere-Powered Desktop Computer

description:
OpenSSL 3.4 brings new cryptographic features, including integrity-only cipher suites for TLS 1.3, ECC optimizations, and FIPS provider updates.

The post OpenSSL 3.4 Introduces New APIs, FIPS Updates appeared first on Linux Today.
title: OpenSSL 3.4 Introduces New APIs, FIPS Updates
